title: Income Inequality in the U.S.: A Statistical Analysis
description: An analysis of income distribution trends in the U.S. using Gini coefficients and Lorenz curves, examining factors such as education and industry shifts.

title: Predicting Stock Market Movements with Sentiment Analysis
description: A machine learning model trained on financial news sentiment data to predict short-term stock price changes.

title: Gender Wage Gap: Myth or Reality?
description: Using regression analysis to measure wage differentials across industries while controlling for experience, education, and job type.

title: Cryptocurrency Volatility and Market Trends
description: A time-series analysis of Bitcoin and Ethereum price movements, examining volatility clustering and external macroeconomic influences.

title: The Economics of College Tuition: Are We in a Bubble?
description: An empirical study on rising tuition costs, loan debt trends, and labor market returns on higher education degrees.

title: Impact of Inflation on Consumer Spending Habits
description: An econometric study analyzing shifts in consumer spending behavior in response to inflationary pressures over the past decade.

title: Behavioral Economics in Online Shopping
description: A study on how default options, free shipping, and time-limited discounts influence consumer decision-making in e-commerce.

title: The Effect of Minimum Wage Increases on Employment
description: A difference-in-differences analysis of employment trends in states that raised their minimum wage versus those that did not.

title: Housing Market Trends: Are We in a Bubble?
description: Using price-to-rent ratios and mortgage affordability indexes to evaluate whether current housing prices are overvalued.

title: Rideshare Pricing: A Game Theory Perspective
description: An analysis of how Uber and Lyft use surge pricing and price-matching strategies from a game theory perspective.

title: Sports Analytics: Do Higher Salaries Lead to More Wins?
description: A regression analysis examining the relationship between team payrolls and performance outcomes in professional sports leagues.

title: Machine Learning for Credit Scoring Models
description: Exploring the use of logistic regression and decision trees in predicting credit risk using FICO scores and financial history.
